page.title: 14PIG FARMING IN ROXWELL
page.content: {Stonehill Farm}is used for breeding {PIGS.}It covers three acres of land and has several sheds for pigs at different ages. Each sow has about ten piglets at a time and they stay with their mothers for two to three weeks. They are kept in special pens so the sows cannot squash them. The piglets are then separated from their mothers and put into pens with about twenty-five other pigs. There are over two hundred and fifty pigs in the shed. They are called weaners at this age. After this some pigs are sent to be fattened at another farm and then slaughtered for meat. There are about twenty-five other sows expecting their piglets and some more in another shed with the boars. Some of the sows are kept in a shed and have a field to go into as well. The farm was quite spacious and the pigs clean and happy.
